result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert P Kosterman

records.addlTxt: Court contacted by the State to cancel the defendants midpoint review of the DPA due to defendants compliance in the program. Court scheduled final review hearing for the DPA.

Defendant Robert P Kosterman in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  
Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Case in court for Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing. 
Court is in receipt of  the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Elements of the Offense.

The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement. 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and entered a plea of GUILTY
Defendant  examined as to the plea.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  
The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
The Court reviewed the Early Intervention Program Deferred Prosecution Agreement with the defendant.  
The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the proceedings suspended until Review Hearing.  
Parties informed this matter has been reassigned to Judge Davis Br. 21. Review Hearing scheduled.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to branch 17, Judge Carolina Stark, in Room 400 of the Courthouse.  Review Hearing scheduled on 10/10/22 at 8:30.
Court modified the no firearms order to allow a firearm during firearm safety course.

Defendant Robert P Kosterman in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  
Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Status conference held.  Atty. Mogren requests a plea and sentencing date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Appointing Counsel at County Expense, signed and filed.  rmm

See Order appointing counsel for specific monthly due dates for this pending ATTYF case # 2022CM000497.  Bond will be held in the AFTES account to be applied towards attorney fees upon receipt of the attorneys Affidavit and Order for Payment of Attorney Fees and Costs Due form.

Defendant Robert P Kosterman in court.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Hearing held via Zoom and live streamed through DA Cast.  Indigency hearing proceeded.  Court makes a finding that defendant is indigent.  Court appoints Joel Mogren as counsel for defendant at the rate of $100.00 per hour.  Attorney Mogren accepts appointment.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the rate of $100.00 on the 1st of every month, commencing 5/01/22 until paid in full. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527  Status conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (3-18-2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Robert P Kosterman in court.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 01. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 01.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/16/22 @ 2p
